thread.title: Walker to take five official visits despite OSU verbal commitment
thread.title_full: Walker to take five official visits despite OSU verbal commitment

title: Walker to take five official visits despite OSU verbal commitment
text:
Walker to take five official visits despite OSU verbal commitment October 10, 2015, 5:40 PM Last updated: Saturday, October 10, 2015, 5:49 PM By Keith Idec MICHAEL KARAS/STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER Kareem Walker is exploring his options, deciding to take five official college visits. 
Kareem Walker’s trip to Michigan this weekend was the DePaul star’s first official college visit, but it won’t be his last. 
A source close to Walker said today that the highly touted tailback also plans to take official visits to Alabama, Mississippi and Ohio State on dates to be determined. The Irvington resident is considering taking an official visit to Arizona State as well. 
Walker remains committed to Ohio State, the school he Tweeted he’d attend during halftime of the Buckeyes’ national championship victory over Oregon on Jan. 12. He is exploring his options in accordance with NCAA guidelines, though, because Walker can’t sign a binding national letter of intent until Feb. 3. 
Walker, who could not be reached for comment today, flew to Michigan this morning along with DePaul teammate Quayshon Alexander, a senior defensive end from Haledon who committed to Nebraska in June. They’re attending the Northwestern-Michigan game today in Ann Arbor as part of their official visits. 
The 6-foot-1, 210-pound Walker is rated the No. 1 senior running back in the country by ESPN.com and Rivals.com. 
Rivals ranks Walker as the No. 21 senior prospect overall, regardless of position. ESPN.com ranks him No. 22 overall. 
Walker has rushed for 606 yards and five touchdowns on 94 carries in five games this season for DePaul (1-4), ranked No. 5 in The Record Non-Public Top 6. Walker sat out most of the first quarter of a nationally televised, 15-13 loss to Bergen Catholic on Friday night for undisclosed reasons. But he rushed for 146 yards, including a 5-yard touchdown in the fourth quarter, on 23 carries. 
Email: idec@northjersey.com
